definition: main hall of a Buddhist temple
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: You have to wait in a large entrance hall before being shown into the court proper.
sentences.chinese: 进入皇宫时先要在入口大厅等候，由人带领进入正殿。

sentences.english: Behind the hall is the residence of the abbot and monks.
sentences.chinese: 正殿后面是方丈和僧人的住处。

sentences.english: Now for the main hall of the Buddha Temple was built in the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 现在佛光寺的正殿为唐代所建。

sentences.english: I pursued my walk to an arched door opening to the interior of the abbey.
sentences.chinese: 我继续走去，来到一扇通往大寺正殿的拱门前面。

sentences.english: In the main hall of things in the gallery has large murals.
sentences.chinese: 在正殿的东西廊中有大型壁画。

sentences.english: The primary hall is the largest building.
sentences.chinese: 其中正殿规模最大，是主体建筑。

sentences.english: In its main hall, there enshrined a sitting statue of Avaloktesvara sending a child.
sentences.chinese: 进入院门先来看正殿，这儿供奉的是送子观音坐像。

definition: main hall of a Buddhist temple
(literary) halls (of a palace or a temple)
Hall of Great Strength, main hall of a Buddhist temple containing the main image of veneration 大雄[da4 xiong2]
Hall of Supreme Harmony, the largest of the three halls that constitute the heart of the Outer Court of the Forbidden City 紫禁城[Zi3 jin4 cheng2]
a room in a Buddhist monastery/a temple
warm room/warm partition of a room
